data.title: Checksum
data.statement:
A checksum is  a way of verifying the integrity of packets over a network. Given a key, the length of a message inside the packet, and the packet itself, write a program that prints out a decoded message only if the checksum is correct - otherwise, print out the word "ERROR".

In this case, the checksum is verified by adding all of the bytes of a packet together (EXCEPT FOR THE LAST ONE) and performing the modulus operator on the result, using the key. If this equals the checksum, the message inside the packet is correct.
data.constraints:
1≤ [[K]]≤256
<<This means that the checksum can only be represented by a single byte!>>
1≤ [[N]]≤50
All of the bytes inside the packet can be converted to printable ASCII characters, EXCEPT for the checksum.
data.stubGenerator:
read K:int
read N:int
read P:string(50)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: An integer [[K]] representing the key used to verify the checksum.
<<Line 2>>: An integer [[N]] representing the number of bytes in the packet <<NOT INCLUDING THE CHECKSUM>>
<<Line 3>>: A packet [[P]] containing [[N]]+1 bytes, represented in hexadecimal. The last byte of this packet is the checksum.
data.outputDescription: <<A single line>>: Either the original packet shown in ASCII format with the checksum omitted, <<OR>> the word "ERROR".

lastVersion.statementHTML:
The program:
A checksum is a way of verifying the integrity of packets over a network. Given a key, the length of a message inside the packet, and the packet itself, write a program that prints out a decoded message only if the checksum is correct - otherwise, print out the word "ERROR".

In this case, the checksum is verified by adding all of the bytes of a packet together (EXCEPT FOR THE LAST ONE) and performing the modulus operator on the result, using the key. If this equals the checksum, the message inside the packet is correct.
INPUT:
Line 1: An integer K representing the key used to verify the checksum.
Line 2: An integer N representing the number of bytes in the packet NOT INCLUDING THE CHECKSUM
Line 3: A packet P containing N+1 bytes, represented in hexadecimal. The last byte of this packet is the checksum.

OUTPUT:
A single line: Either the original packet shown in ASCII format with the checksum omitted, OR the word "ERROR".

CONSTRAINTS:
1≤ K≤256
This means that the checksum can only be represented by a single byte!
1≤ N≤50
All of the bytes inside the packet can be converted to printable ASCII characters, EXCEPT for the checksum.

EXAMPLE:
Input
45
13
48656c6c6f2c20576f726c642104
Output
Hello, World!
